page.title: 10Scotton/Northorpe: Trade
page.content: Both villages have a general shop with post office facilities providing a valuable service; fresh bread is delivered here daily. The range of goods stocked is limited and most families shop (weekly) at Gainsborough or Scunthorpe. There is a daily (week- day) doorstep milk delivery; other tradesmen's vans call weekly or more frequently, with meat, fresh fish and coal. A window cleaner calls every fortnight; Scotton has a resident self employed plumber, car repairer, house decorator, removal man and several builders. Northorpe has 2/3 builders, a painter, decorator and joiner (who is also an undertaker). There is a daily weekday house to house postal delivery, with a morning and afternoon collection of mail from each P.O. Most houses have a phone and there is a public phone box in both villages.
